multi_topic_discovery.topic_discovery_motivation: Impact: equities; A major cybersecurity breach involving Google’s Gmail platform could pressure the technology sector, potentially impacting indices such as the S&P 500 and Nasdaq.

category.motivation: The article reports a security advisory issued by Google to its users, which is a company news event unrelated to earnings.

impact.motivation: No node provided to assess relevance to the article.

time_frame.motivation: The article reports a recent security breach and immediate user guidance, affecting Gmail users right now.

article_node.title: Why Google Is Really Warning 2.5 Billion Gmail Users to Stop Using Their Password
article_node.summary: Google warns 2.5 billion Gmail users to stop using passwords after a Salesforce breach that exposed business data, raising phishing risk. The breach didn’t steal credentials but gave attackers detailed contact info, enabling sophisticated impersonation and vishing campaigns. Google recommends regular password changes, two‑factor authentication, and especially adopting passkeys or app‑based 2FA. The company urges users to be skeptical of unsolicited messages and to use its Security Checkup tool. This highlights how partner data leaks can threaten even non‑targeted accounts.
